meanings.definition: Grummeting (verb): the act of securing or fastening with a grummet
meanings.sent1: She was grummeting the rope to the pole to make sure it stayed in place.
meanings.sent2: The sailor was grummeting the sail to the mast before setting off on the voyage.
meanings.sent3: The cat was grummeting its favorite toy to the scratching post, thinking it was a clever game.
meanings.sent4: His words grummeted her heart, securing a place for him in her thoughts.
meanings.sent5: The image of the old man grummeting the lock shut stayed with her as a symbol of safety.

meanings.definition: Grummeting (noun): a small metal or rope ring used for securing or fastening
meanings.sent1: She found a rusty grummeting in the toolbox, perfect for fixing the broken strap.
meanings.sent2: The grummeting on the sail was loose, causing the fabric to flap in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The tiny grummeting rolled off the table and onto the floor, becoming a playful toy for the cat.
meanings.sent4: Her necklace was adorned with a unique grummeting, symbolizing her love for sailing.
meanings.sent5: The grummeting on the old chest held memories of adventures long past.

meanings.definition: Grummeting (adjective): relating to or characteristic of grummeting
meanings.sent1: The grummeting tool was essential for repairing the torn fabric.
meanings.sent2: His grummeting skills were unmatched, making him the go-to person for securing items.
meanings.sent3: The grummeting pattern on the fabric reminded her of the ocean waves, bringing a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes sparkled with a grummeting joy when she saw the perfectly secured knot.
meanings.sent5: The grummeting design on the bracelet added a touch of nautical charm to her outfit.
